ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: If someone gives you an item, it s a gift... nuff said. There are quite a few genuinely good players out there who remember how hard it was to start out and
ygData.messageBody:
If someone gives you an item, it's a gift...'nuff
said. There are quite a few genuinely good players out
there who remember how hard it was to start out and
therefore give things to non-twinked noobs. I like to give
stuff away unless I'm desperate for plat...I hate
trying to sell stuff. For example, most of the bronze
armor I get in Sol B and the velium weapons I get in
velious I don't even bother selling, I plant the stuff on
rats and snakes and stuff in WFP. (Hmmm...how could a
snake wear a bronze breastplate?) I figure it's a nice
surprise for a noob. Also just about every time I go to
Freeport I buy a couple backpacks and hand them out to
non-twinks. Remember what a pain it was to only have a few
inventory slots for those rat whiskers and snake
eggs?<br><br>I will admit, all my characters are twinks. My boss
bought my first character almost a full set of banded.
When I created my bard I passed that on to her as well
as the whopping 30pp my warrior had on her BUT I
didn't wear the banded till lvl 5, i just got her full
leather cuz I felt banded was too much of an unfair
advantage. I've lightened up since. That banded eventually
went to my shadow knight and then when she upgraded it
went on the rats and snakes in WFP. :o) Now that my
bard is much higher in level she can afford nicer
stuff for my alts and sure it makes life easier on
them. But I didn't start out at lvl 1 with a full suit
of FP. And sure, sometimes it irritates me a bit to
see a lvl 9 bard in full lambent (or singing steel!)
when I had to work so damn hard to get mine...but it's
a game and you're supposed to have fun. I had fun
doing the lambent quests...but if a person would rather
buy their quest armor because that is what it takes
to have fun...then more power to 'em. To each their
own.<br><br>Funnily enough, DAoC has made me some serious plat.
Several friends have quit EQ to play it and have given me
their stuff. The stuff I got from them is what I used
to twink my other characters and whatever they
couldn't use I sold or often just gave away. But some of
the better stuff I sold and now have 2kpp in the
bank...the most I have ever had at one time. (That probably
doesn't sound like much to some of you but it's quite a
bit to me). <br><br>Bottom line is, if ya wanna
twink, go for it. If you don't, don't. You're PAYING for
the game so you have the right to enjoy it whether it
be as a twink or not.<br><br>~Mystii Shadowsoul<br>
Lvl 48 Bardess
